box2D.collision.shapes.B2Shape

type
class
subclasses
box2D.collision.shapes.B2CircleShape, box2D.collision.shapes.B2EdgeShape, box2D.collision.shapes.B2PolygonShape
A shape is used for collision detection. Shapes are created in b2Body. You can use shape for collision detection before they are attached to the world.

Static Variables

e_circleShape : Int

e_edgeShape : Int

e_hitCollide : Int

Return value for TestSegment indicating a hit.

e_missCollide : Int

Return value for TestSegment indicating a miss.

e_polygonShape : Int

e_shapeTypeCount : Int

e_startsInsideCollide : Int

Return value for TestSegment indicating that the segment starting point, p1, is already inside the shape.

e_unknownShape : Int

The various collision shape types supported by Box2D.

Static Methods

testOverlap(shape1 : B2Shape, transform1 : box2D.common.math.B2Transform, shape2 : B2Shape, transform2 : box2D.common.math.B2Transform) : Bool

Constructor

new()

Instance Variables

m_radius : Float

m_type : Int

Instance Methods

computeAABB(aabb : box2D.collision.B2AABB, xf : box2D.common.math.B2Transform) : Void

parameters
aabb returns the axis aligned box.
xf the world transform of the shape.
Given a transform, compute the associated axis aligned bounding box for this shape.

computeMass(massData : B2MassData, density : Float) : Void

parameters
massData returns the mass data for this shape.
Compute the mass properties of this shape using its dimensions and density. The inertia tensor is computed about the local origin, not the centroid.

computeSubmergedArea(normal : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, offset : Float, xf : box2D.common.math.B2Transform, c : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Float

parameters
normal the surface normal
offset the surface offset along normal
xf the shape transform
c returns the centroid
returns
the total volume less than offset along normal
Compute the volume and centroid of this shape intersected with a half plane

copy() : B2Shape

Clone the shape

getType() : Int

returns
the shape type.
Get the type of this shape. You can use this to down cast to the concrete shape.

rayCast(output : box2D.collision.B2RayCastOutput, input : box2D.collision.B2RayCastInput, transform : box2D.common.math.B2Transform) : Bool

parameters
output the ray-cast results.
input the ray-cast input parameters.
transform the transform to be applied to the shape.
Cast a ray against this shape.

set(other : B2Shape) : Void

Assign the properties of anther shape to this

testPoint(xf : box2D.common.math.B2Transform, p : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Bool

parameters
xf the shape world transform.
p a point in world coordinates.
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
